abstract.text: Instantiates and returns a new correlation instance with the provided device and metadata.

The start date for the sample. This date must be equal to or earlier than the end date; otherwise, this method throws an exception (
The end date for the sample. This date must be equal to or later than the start date; otherwise, this method throws an exception (
A set of
objects. Specifically, this set contains the quantity and category samples to be grouped into this correlation.
The device that generated the data for this sample.
The metadata dictionary containing extra information that describes this correlation. The dictionary’s keys are all
objects . The values may be

objects. For a complete list of predefined metadata keys, see Metadata Keys.
Using predefined keys helps facilitate sharing data between apps; however, you are also encouraged to create custom keys as needed to extend the HealthKit sample’s capabilities.
When creating correlations representing food, always use the
key to provide the food’s name.
A new correlation instance.

Use a correlation object to represent composite data—that is, a sample that requires more than a single value. To create a correlation sample, first create the quantity and category samples you intend to combine into the correlation. Next, create the correlation’s type. Finally, instantiate the correlation, passing in the type, start date, end date, samples, device, and metadata as shown below.
Use this method when recording data using external hardware. If you do not need to include additional metadata, pass
for the
parameter.

code: fatalError("*** Unable to create the systolic type ****")
quantity: systolicQuantity, startDate: date, endDate: date)
fatalError("*** Unable to create the diastolic type ***")
quantity: diastolicQuantity, startDate: date, endDate: date)
fatalError("*** Unable to create the blood pressure type ***")
let bloodpressure = HKCorrelation(type: bloodPressureType, startDate: date, endDate: date, objects:objects, device: device, metadata: metadata)

abstract.text: A representation of a specific point in time, for use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
Name of an exception that occurs when you pass an invalid argument to a method, such as a `nil` pointer where a non-`nil` object is required.
An object wrapper for primitive scalar numeric values.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
A sample that groups multiple related samples into a single entry.
The type for this correlation.
Instantiates and returns a new correlation instance.
Instantiates and returns a new correlation instance with the provided device and metadata.
Instantiates and returns a new correlation instance with the provided metadata.
The set of sample objects that make up the correlation.
A type that identifies samples that group multiple subsamples.
A device that generates data for HealthKit.
The type of food that the HealthKit object represents.
The metadata for this HealthKit object.
Returns the shared correlation type for the provided identifier.
A HealthKit sample represents a piece of data associated with a start and end time.
The sample’s end date.
The sample’s start date.
A representation of a specific point in time, for use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
An unordered collection of unique elements.
